body: Ahh good catch—updated that README file!
Thanks!

It's something I plan to do.

Most of the apps are copied and modified from https://github.com/GoogleChrome/chrome-app-samples, but some of it are from https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/samples, which has no licence. I will add a license in each example app directory.
I'm closing it since it is not a issue of electron-sample-apps.
The flash packaging issue is more likely to a issue of `electron-packager` repo, an is already tracked in maxogden/electron-packager#114. So I'm closing this issue.
Will this capture the audio from the Mac too.  I read in nwjs that audio only works on windows?
@BigTundra  No. The capturer API doesn't capture the audio.

@sapioit Thanks for your contributions!
Could you merge the commit in #12 into this PR since they are relevant to the same thing?
I don't know how...  I used the web editor and did not forked the git...
:+1 Thanks for your contributions!
@sapioit That's ok. I have merged the two PRs. Thanks.
So we might need a way to capture the audio, too, huh?
@hokein this is really cool!
Could you open the dev-tools console and see the output message?

@ChongTang 
Thanks for the contributions! Rather than adding the fake options, I prefer to remove the `crashReporter` in FileExplorer. The `crashReporter` seems useless in this sample.
Agree!
Just the first one need to be merged if accepted.

Thanks for finding it.
I'm not willing to update the new APIs because it is not compatible, which will break the sample running on early versions of electron.
@ChongTang Are you willing to work on this? Otherwise, I can do it for you.
Closing it in favour of #17 .
Thanks.
Thanks!
Thanks! The `sharedObj` isn't mentioned in Electron's document yet. After atom/electron#4392 gets merged, I will merge it.
Wait I removed the IPC and used only the shared object, renamed it to helloworld-sharedobj. Will make a new PR.
Discard that pull-request, I have made a simpler helloworld-sharedobj, I will redo another one for a proper IPC example (without shared objects).
Did you find the answer for this issue?
I haven't checked it ever since. Will try, one of those days... probably...
Thanks!
Good catch, thanks!

Hi, anyone got chance check this? 
The disable capture button doesn't work for me as well, from dev-tools, localStream.stop is not a function.
electron version v0.36.5

Thanks for the contribution!  Looks good to me. 

BTW, Do you test it on Windows?
@hokein yeah, I only got chance to test it on Windows with electron v0.36.5
Thanks!
What do you mean by saving the recording?
Save the file as  `recording.mp4` or `recording.webm`. Instead of displaying it on a `video`tag.
@hokein In the `desktop-capture` project, it gives you a button to Enable Capture but the stream is sent to the `<video>` tag. How do you save the stream to a file?
I think I fixed this in Pull Request #27
@hokein Sorry I forgot to mention the sample folder name. Thank you @styfle for clarifying that one :+1:

@styfle 
Awesome! Thanks for your contribution.
Closing it as fixed in #27.
I'd suggest you to seek help in electron [community](https://github.com/electron/electron#community).
Maybe you can also use [electron-compile](https://github.com/electron/electron-compile) for mp3-encoder

The samples use deprecated APIs, which are removed in v1.0.0. Currently, you can use v0.37.8 to run the sample.
Closing this in favour of #28 .

Thanks! I saw the referenced issue, it mentions deprecated rather than discontinued API functions that make it not run, so it's not a duplicate issue. Newcomers will scan open issues only if following the readme leads to errors.
Indeed the examples work with a former version, `npm install -g electron-prebuilt@0.37.8` did the trick.
It does not work when google chrome is already running on my PC. When I close browser and start electron app everything goes just fine.
Great, thanks!
I'd suggest you to use https://github.com/electron-userland/electron-packager.

Hello @mannycolon, the `readme` has already mentioned how to run the sample code.

For tutorials building electron apps step-by-step, I recommend you to read https://github.com/feross/electron-workshop.

PepperFlashPlayer v23.0.0.205 is used in Chrome 54, but the latest Electron v1.4.4 is still based on Chrome 53, so you need to use the version of PepperFlashPlayer which is corresponding to Chrome 53.0.2785.113 (I don't the exact version for it because my chrome is 54 already). 

Maybe I should clarify the readme document of the pepper sample. The current words `Copy from Chrome Browser` are a bit of misleading.
I should go see download the correct PepperFlashPlayer?
Yeah, exactly. I found that chrome 53 is using 23.0.0.162.
Thanks!

There should be an electron API for it. I think you could find more details in the discussion of https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/1956.

The `readme` of `client-certificate` sample might not keep with the latest status of electron, pull requests are always welcome 😄 

I'm closing it as this is not an issue related to this repository.
Thanks @herrmannplatz 👍

The `Notification` used in `window.js` is a HTML5 API, it is a build-in API in browser. In other words, you need to call it in renderer process.

For using `Notification` API in main process, please use the `notification` module provided by electron (since v1.7.3 beta).

The document of `Notification` in the sample is kind of out-of-dated, patch are always welcome. :)

Issues of `electron-sample-apps` are for feature requests and bug reports. I'd suggest you asking questions about using Electron [community](https://github.com/electron/electron#community) or the [Slack Channel](http://atom-slack.herokuapp.com/).
Yes, the version of Pepper Flash Plugin should be aligned with the one being used in the Electron's Chromium version.
@cervenyprofiq 👍 Thanks!
Yes, it's very good idea and important API. 🏷 😃
Thanks!
I recorded a video to give more info about the issue... [video](https://youtu.be/G8Be1rCXhHQ) Selecting the menu item is invoking the main menu.
Hey @staminna mind giving a little more details? perhaps some code or examples would help.

Adding `app.commandLine.appendSwitch('--ignore-gpu-blacklist');` in your `main.js` should fix the issue.
Thanks! 😄
visit "chrome://gpu" probably gives you some clues.
I haven't tried it on Windows 10, it seems a bug of electron,  I'd suggest you filing/redirecting the bug there.
Closing it now unless more information provided.

@hokein I feel like this is a bug in electron. I posted in the electron discourse forum but didn't got any reply. Did you got the chance to look into it ? Do you think I should create an issue in electron github? :slightly_smiling_face:
@cg-cnu, sorry, currently I don't have bandwidth to look into it. But if you think it is an electron bug, just create an issue in electron's github repo (with a minimal reproducible application).
@hokein. That's completely fine. I will create an issue and track it. Thanks :smile:
Thank you very much for your comment and sorry for my slow reply. I will do as you suggest.
@anshumanv Thanks for pointing it out! PRs are always welcome.
Alright, coming
👍 Thanks!
@jkeam Thanks!
Thanks for the contribution. I'm closing this PR as it is actually not working. Feel free to reopen it again when it is ready.
Could you provide the electron version you are using? It may be an electron bug.
I'm closing it out, free free to reopen it.
@hokein Sorry didn't got the chance to work on it again. I will look into it later. Sorry for the trouble.
@cg-cnu no problem. Contributions are always welcome :)
For those who may find this thread in future, the solution can be found here: https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/10642
@TennyZhuang Thanks!
@asmallfurrywombat Can you report this issue to electron repository? This repository isn't intended for the electron-specific issues.
Maybe redirect your issue to electron repository, I don't many contexts on Window10 notification stuff.

I'm having the same problem on Mac and Windows.
electron --version
v1.8.4

In my case, in windows registry, in HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT there is a subfolder named .js and in the Content Type key I changed from text/plain to application/javascript. 

Thanks @joncombe
Can you share the commands you're using and the output you're seeing? That will make it easier to diagnose the problem.

Maybe you tried to run a `npm start` command instead of `electron <electron-sample-apps-path>/<sample-name>`. 
Below the instructions  (contained in the Readme!)

> ## How to run apps
> 
> 1. Install Electron via `npm install -g electron`.
> 
> 2. Run the sample via `electron <electron-sample-apps-path>/<sample-name>`.
@Leonardonline mentioned above, `npm start` is not supported yet.
@prahladyeri zepto is smaller not necessarily faster and shorter code.  That is basically the only reason to use it IMO.
Thanks.
